intro: Cryptantha circumscissa var. genuina, commonly known as the narrowleaf cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and dry, open habitats, such as grasslands and scrublands. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. This variety is distinguished by its narrow leaves and is often found in association with other desert flora.
